paper_metadata.title: Germline mutations in cancer-predisposition genes in patients with biliary tract cancer
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted pathogenic variants in the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two other BRCA2 variants, c.5574_5577 delAATT (p. Ile1859Lys fsX3) and c.1887_1888 insA (p. Thr630Asn fsX6), resulting in frameshift mutations were detected in a male patient with IHBD cancer diagnosed at 57-years old.

functional_data.summary: The variant is classified as pathogenic based on its effects on the protein and its presence in multiple families with breast cancer.

variants.segregation_data: Found in at least three families, two of which had multiple instances of breast cancer.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on family history and classification as pathogenic.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history of metachronous cancers of the biliary tract and prostate cancer in the father and lung cancer in the mother.
key_quotes: suggesting it as the most frequent pathogenic variant in China

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two other BRCA2 variants, c.5574_5577 delAATT (p. Ile1859Lys fsX3) and c.1887_1888 insA (p. Thr630Asn fsX6), resulting in frameshift mutations were detected in a female patient with IHBD cancer diagnosed at 55-years old.

functional_data.summary: The clinical significance or functional effects of this variant are not reported.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on classification as pathogenic.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history of breast cancer diagnosed in an aunt at 30-years old.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
